sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Guibert of Tournai OFM, Sermones ad uarios status. Nicholas of Lyre OFM, Postilla litteralis in uetus et nouum testamentum (excerpts)
[Untitled]
msDesc.p: Paper, 295 207 , 11.6 x 8.3, ff. 11 + 268, double columns of 41, etc. lines. Cent. xiv late, clearly written in various hands.
Collation: a12 (one canc.) 112-512 (two cancelled in second half) 612-912 1010 1110 1212-2012 2116 2210 238.
Old binding as for the rest: one metal tag at bottom of first cover, two tags, one perforated, at bottom of the other: two bosses remain: old label ·106· (?).
Table of contents in first cover (f. bv).

msItem.head: Guibert of Tournai OFM, Sermones ad uarios status

head.title: Sermones fr. Gilberti de ordine minorum

msItem.ab: Preceded by a table (f. ir) and some extracts, apparently legal
Also by the following in other hands
Extracts from a gloss on the Epistles (Lyra)
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt sermones fratris giberti de toronaco (or corgnaco) ordinis fratrum minorum
msItem.incipit: Exsecutis inspirante domino sex partibus secundi tractatus cuius est titulus de condicione doctoris
msItem.explicit: aliter matrone et sic de aliis. Rogemus ergo, etc.
msItem.rubric: Explicit opus fratris Gilberti ordinis minorum fratrum et continet solempnes et literales materias ad diuersos status. A. d. mo ccco xciiio sequenti sabbato post festum sancti Martini, etc. est finis istius operis

msItem.head: Nicholas of Lyre OFM, Postilla litteralis in uetus et nouum testamentum (excerpts)
msItem.ab: ff. 149r-249v are occupied with extracts from Lyra's postillae upon nearly all the Biblical books

msItem.head: Michael Blide, Disputatio de censibus perpetuis

msItem.ab: Extracts from a Canon Law book
Called in the list of contents: De quibusdam in iure canonico circa decretales

recordHist.p: markupCheck: checked by BA, SP, CF
